Thanks very much for the quick reply. I will definitely look into this...

-----Original Message-----
From: stack [mailto:stack@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 2004 11:47 AM
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Using Heritrix with an existing interface


jcgoodkin wrote:

>Hi,
>
>We are investigating replacing our in-houser harvester with an open 
>source harvester and are seriously considering Heritrix. 
>  
>
Nice to hear.

>I was wondering if there is a way to define and send heritrix a job 
>without going through the web UI. We have some existing interefaces 
>that I am pretty sure we are going to want to keep, because they are 
>very simple. 
>
>The Heritrix interface is very nice, and I can seeing making use of 
>it as well, but it does require a fairly sophisticated user. 
>
>I would be interested to know if there is a way to run heritrix as a 
>service rather than as an applicaiton.
>
>  
>
We intend to spend better packaging Heritrix so it can be more easily 
embedded by other apps but in the meantime, checkout how Heritrix sets 
up the selftest.  See here: 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/Heritrix.html#584.
<http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/Heritrix.html#584.>   
The bulk of this method is launching a webapp for the selftest to go up 
against but its the rest is a fairly contained example of a crawl setup 
and launch without use of the UI.

St.Ack

>Thanks!
>
>Jay
>
>
>
>
>
>
